page.title: 19History of Acklington (2)
page.content: {1856}Opening of Railway. {1859}Acklington Parish separated from Warkworth. {1861}Church was built. {1862}Village Library opened. {1865}Bridge was built over Coquet. Highest ever school roll of 100. {1914 - 1919 }World War I - 60 men served from Acklington Parish. {1921}Lychgate built as war memorial to those who died in First War. {1925}Village Hall built. {1938}Acklington Airfield Opened. {1939 - 1945 }World War II - Evacuees from Wallsend sent to village. {1947}Severe snowstorms isolate village {1953}Village celebrated the coronation of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II {1959}Acklington Parish again joins with Warkworth. {1972}Prison complex established on site of old airfield.
